members.about_me: Creativeflow Intuitive Art, Meditation & Therapy provides a safe and positive space for exploration, free expression, and healing. The project aims to nurture our authentic selves and invite people to explore the beauty of their creative energy.

members.about_me: Lauren FergusonÕs practice is primarily concerned with a sense of place which she develops through an in-depth exploration of the history, architecture and associated objects within spaces that she has a personal connection.

members.name: Tara Mac
members.about_me: Hi, I'm Tara! I worked for over 10 years in both in-house and agency roles before deciding to go it alone. I offer branding and website design services, primarily for makers and fellow creatives. Check out my website to have a look at my work.

members.name: George Beckwith
members.about_me: Ive always had a passion for the designing of products and finding what makes them appealing; visually and practically. I often find myself sketching out new ideas at any point in the day, and furthering this by making them out of whatever I can get hold of.

members.name: Cate Nelson-Shaw
members.about_me: An ambitious and strategic leader, I make an impact by combining my enterprising mindset, commercial focus and entrepreneurial flair. I creatively lead organisation growth and sustainability with openness and honestly to deliver objectives and make a difference. I am an accomplished communicator, influencer and ambassador with a flair for making connections and I have terrific networks. My engaging and compelling disposition is energising, making me a sought after change-maker. I participated on the Principally Women Leadership Development Programme. Delivered in partnership with Scottish Enterprise, the programme was for senior women business leaders with leadership potential to support scale up. I am passionate about equalities, diversity and inclusion and support and inspire others to realise their capability and potential, lifting as I climb. I am sought as a public speaker and often commissioned to write for national and local media. Enhancing my Executive career, I serve as a Non-Executive Director on a number of Boards, including Changing the Chemistry, whose vision is to change the chemistry in the boardroom, so people and boards embrace diversity of thought; and Dance Base, Scotland's National Centre for Dance where I was also Chair the Development Committee. Previously I was on the Board at Creative Scotland, the Marketing Society Scotland and Scotland Malawi Partnership. I was a Mentee on the Scottish Government's Board Chair Mentoring Scheme, having been nominated by the Chair of Creative Scotland. The scheme developed the existing talent of Board members to become future Chairs of Public Sector organisations. I began my career on the Graduate Programme at The Boots Company PLC, now Walgreens Boots Alliance, a global leader in retail and wholesale pharmacy; and have since worked both as a client in entrepreneurial start ups, family companies and in agencies directing client accounts. In 2013 I founded and grew entrepreneurial start up Yellowbook, a strategic, marketing and communications consultancy targeting ambitious growth companies within Scotland’s flourishing SME sector. I have a Chartered Postgraduate Diploma from the Chartered Institute of Marketing, am a Business Leader with the Marketing Society Scotland and Judge for their Annual STAR Awards.

members.name: Agnes Wang
members.about_me: Worked as a Press Officer for Summerhall during Fringe, and now working as in the Communication and Advertising team in United Nations Environment Programme.

members.name: Sara Robertson
members.about_me: Professionally, I worked in ad agencies, and now for one of the industry associations. Personally, I am interested in a wide range of craft.

members.name: Abi Avery
members.about_me: I am a professional photographer based in Edinburgh, Scotland. Specialising in sports and portraiture, I work with a mix of mediums to produce a variety of work. Working in the industry for over six years has led me to create a collection of content. Ruisg Conasg has been exhibited in two Edinburgh locations and my most recent project is being exhibited in London.

members.name: Ashleigh Thow
members.about_me: I am an experienced membership engagement professional based in Edinburgh. With a background in marketing, communications and events, I found my niche working in membership and community engagement. I am currently Alumni Relations Manager at Edinburgh Napier University. At Edinburgh Napier, I lead on alumni communications, student/recent graduate engagement plus flagship alumni campaigns such as the Alumni Awards initiative and the School of Arts and Creative Industries (SACI) Alumni Hall of Fame.

members.name: Chris Melvin
members.about_me: My name’s Chris, an award-winning creative do-gooder with over a decade of experience. Based in Edinburgh, I’ve worked for top UK brands in agencies and freelance alike. I'm a proud Frankenstein creative, stitching together design, video and art direction with witty wordplay and digital know-how. Strategy is the bolt of lightning that brings it to life.

members.name: Viktoria K
members.about_me: Hi there, I am Viktoria, a lifelong creative who grew up working in the film industry. During the past few years, I opened a business and also transitioned into the tech industry. However, I have now decided to pursue my passion for entrepreneurship once again, which led me to establish my Virtual Assistance Agency, ACTIVATE. At ACTIVATE, I collaborate with creatives, entrepreneurs, and businesses, empowering them to take the next big step in their business. As of February, I have relocated to Edinburgh, eager to explore new opportunities, expand my horizons , and meet new folks.

members.name: Charlie Bell
members.about_me: I am Head of Creative Design at FreeAgent.
members.sector: AI, Software Development and Website Design

members.name: Denys Tochylkin
members.about_me: We started our company in 2001 in Kiev, Ukraine. We have considerable experience successfully developing many projects for European, British and American clients. We have also gained much experience in the public sector by participating in the creation of systems such as e-democracy, e-government, e-voting and electronic document management for city councils. Today, we work largely with clients, maintaining their online business. From the development of marketing strategies to the implementation of sophisticated software products, mobile applications and Internet systems, we are the full service digital agency service. We bring to life the boldest of ideas for new startups and established businesses, generating additional revenue for our clients.
members.sector: AI, Software Development and Website Design

members.name: David Reid
members.about_me: I am a visual artist creating with drawing, sculpture and art objects. My primary source of freelance is income is creative engagement with young people. I have a passion for promoting youth autonomy a voice through creativity and play. Interest in loose parts play, story telling and inclusive practices. Exploring unique approaches to engaging young people in arts and cultural heritage.

members.name: Francesca Bernardi
members.about_me: Francesca Bernardi (PhD, QTS), art-activist and creative coach, founding chair of the Antonio Gramsci Society UK, Global Councillor and Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts (RSA) and Associate Member of CATA (Canadian Art Therapy Association). I am also a Visiting Lecturer in Childhood Studies at the Carnegie School of Education (Leeds Beckett University) and Arts Therapies at the University of Roehampton. Trained in Art and Design education and worked as a teacher and artist-in-residence in schools, Alternative Provision and Further Education. I am a volunteer international board member of the Disability Without Abuse Project (Los Angeles).

members.name: Cameron allan
members.about_me: Hey, I'm Cammie. I'm a photographer working across Scotland and beyond! I work mainly in B2B commercial creative shoots, providing businesses with everything from events photography and headshots to glossy images for marketing and advertising. You might have seen my work on the back pages of some papers as I am one of HIbs' 2 club photographers. You may also have seen some of my lighting work in action on posters for Wonka, The Railway Children Return, and The Lost King, where I worked as 1st Asst, responsible for creating and maintaining the lighting rigs! I'm looking forward to meeting all of the wonderful CE member and seeing what wonderful projects we can work on together! I'm especially interested in developing my work in the fields of editorial and creative portraiture, so if anyone fancies a collaboration there, just let me know!!
members.sector: Film, Social Media, TV, Radio and Other Media

members.name: Mickey Ellis
members.about_me: I am an Edinburgh based creative director and designer. I have recently returned to my home town after living in London since 1998, working predominantly in the fashion, art and music industry. Having founded numerous successful brands I have a vast amount of experience in brand building, strategy and marketing, as well as garment and graphic design. I have recently founded Flux Studio - a creative solutions agency, based in Leith, as a way to connect with local businesses and brands and work together on creative projects that facilitate their growth, while also building my community and providing work for freelancers.
members.sector: Design (Exhibition, Fashion, Game, Graphic and Product)

members.name: Haddon Kime
members.about_me: At my core, I'm a storyteller. This foundation shapes my work as a songwriter, composer, and lyricist for theatre. It also guides my craft as a sound designer and studio engineer. My greatest fulfillment comes from collaborating with teams to bring powerful narratives to life. Originally from North America, I hold dual citizenship in Canada and the United States and am currently based in the UK on a Global Talent Visa.
members.sector: Performing Arts (Comedy, Dance, Music, Opera, Theatre)

members.name: Matthew Richter
members.about_me: I'm a consultant and policy advisor working at the intersection of the arts and commercial real estate. I work with cities and other municipalities to develop strategic policy around cultural space protection; I work with developers to include cultural spaces in new large-scale real estate projects; and I work with community-based cultural organizations to build capacity around large capital projects. I've developed this work in Seattle, Washington, in the US, and have recently relocated to Edinburgh where I'm excited to take part in the cultural life of this incredible city.

members.name: Sophie Venz
members.about_me: I am a freelance writer from Australia who moved to Edinburgh two years ago. Earlier this year I experienced a brain infection, which caused me to become unemployed and to focus on my creative work instead: writing and crafting.

members.name: Beautify Earth
members.about_me: Beautify Earth curates mural and street art projects in partnership with community organizations, community-led developers, and cities. We are a regenerative business with our goals and values in line with advocating for artists and the creative economy, creating more beautiful and sustainable communities, and making art part of our everyday experience. In addition to our agency we are building a cooperative digital platform that features the largest database of mural and street artist portfolios that is open and free for all.

members.name: Edinburgh Chamber of Commerce
members.about_me: As a member of the Edinburgh Chamber of Commerce, you can access a variety of practical benefits designed to help you develop and grow your business. We offer a range of business support tools including networking opportunities, help with marketing, training, policy and advocacy and support with entering new markets. Whether you want to connect with other leaders in the Edinburgh business community, increase your visibility in the Capital, or start trading internationally, we can help.

members.name: Impact Arts
members.about_me: Established in 1994, Impact Arts is an innovative Scottish arts charity whose mission is to tackle inequalities in Scotland through creativity. We aim to address common challenges faced by those living with poverty - improving people’s wellbeing and their life chances, connecting communities and improving access to the arts for Scotland’s most disadvantaged areas.

members.name: Madeleine Shepherd
members.about_me: Textile artist/maker who also takes photographs and writes stories. Most of my work has its roots in science, maths or science fiction. Knot Unktnot has a specific mathematical meaning but it also reflects a lot of of the activity in my studio - knotting/knitting yarn and untangling stuff too

members.name: Jade Chau
members.about_me: I’m a product designer for a fin tech in london. I just moved to Edinburgh and want to start meeting more people professionally and gain more network. I love making new connections and I wanted to make more in my area
members.sector: AI, Software Development and Website Design

members.name: James Ebdon-Jackson
members.about_me: I'm a product manager in tech, with a design background. I have a very user-centric approach to digital products and enjoy working on projects aimed at non-technical users most of all. Outside of my work I enjoy more practical non-digital creative outlets. I like to paint and I have a few projects on the go with physical product design. Resin casting, some light woodwork, and all that jazz!
